Sponge Cake with Applesauce

Jump to Recipe

Sponge Cake with Applesauce is a delightful twist on the classic sponge cake that combines the light, airy texture of traditional sponge with the subtle sweetness and moisture of applesauce. This easy-to-follow recipe is perfect for any occasion, whether you're celebrating a birthday, hosting a family gathering, or simply indulging in a sweet treat at home. Made with simple ingredients such as all-purpose flour, granulated sugar, and fresh eggs, this cake is not only delicious but also versatile. The addition of applesauce not only enhances the flavor but also adds a healthier element to your dessert, making it a great option for those looking to reduce refined sugar intake. In just a few easy steps, you can create a fluffy, moist cake that can be enjoyed on its own or dressed up with your favorite toppings. Get ready to impress your guests with this scrumptious Sponge Cake with Applesauce that is sure to become a family favorite!

Ingredients

all-purpose flour

For a lighter texture, consider using cake flour instead of all-purpose flour. If you're gluten-free, you can substitute with a gluten-free all-purpose flour blend, but be sure to add a binding agent like xanthan gum.

granulated sugar

You can substitute granulated sugar with coconut sugar for a lower glycemic index option. For a natural sweetener, try using honey or maple syrup, but remember to reduce the liquid ingredients slightly to maintain the batter consistency.

baking powder

Ensure your baking powder is fresh for optimal rise. If you don’t have baking powder, you can substitute it with a mix of 1/4 tsp baking soda and 1/2 tsp vinegar or lemon juice.

salt

Salt enhances flavor, but if you're watching your sodium intake, you can reduce it to 1/8 tsp. Alternatively, for added flavor, consider using sea salt or Himalayan pink salt.

eggs

If you need an egg substitute, you can use 1/4 cup unsweetened applesauce, 1/4 cup yogurt, or a flax egg (1 tbsp ground flaxseed mixed with 2.5 tbsp water, let it sit for 5 minutes). Note that using substitutes may alter the texture slightly.

applesauce

Unsweetened applesauce works best to control sugar levels. If you don’t have applesauce, you can use mashed bananas or pureed pears as a substitute. This can also enhance the flavor profile and moisture of the cake.

vanilla extract

Use pure vanilla extract for the best flavor. If you don't have it, you can substitute with vanilla bean paste or a splash of almond extract for a different twist.

butter

If you're looking for a dairy-free option, you can substitute melted butter with coconut oil or a vegan butter substitute. For a healthier option, applesauce can replace some of the butter, reducing the fat content.

powdered sugar

For a healthier dusting option, you can blend granulated sugar in a blender to make your own powdered sugar. Alternatively, use cacao powder or cinnamon for a flavorful dusting.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Preheat the Oven

    Set your oven to 350°F (175°C). This is a crucial step as it ensures that your cake bakes evenly.

  • Step 2: Prepare Your Cake Pan

    Grease a round cake pan with a little butter or cooking spray. This will prevent the cake from sticking to the pan.

  • Step 3: Mix Dry Ingredients

    In a mixing bowl, whisk together 1 cup of all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup of granulated sugar, 1 tsp of baking powder, and 1/4 tsp of salt. This step helps to evenly distribute the baking powder, ensuring a good rise.

  • Step 4: Combine Wet Ingredients

    In another bowl, beat together 3 large eggs. Then, mix in 1/2 cup of applesauce and 1 tsp of vanilla extract until smooth. Make sure the mixture is well-blended to incorporate air for a fluffier cake.

  • Step 5: Combine Wet and Dry Mixtures

    Pour the wet mixture into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. Be careful not to overmix; this can lead to a dense cake.

  • Step 6: Add Melted Butter

    Gently fold in 2 tbsp of melted butter into the batter. This adds richness and moisture to your sponge cake.

  • Step 7: Pour Batter into Pan

    Pour the batter into your prepared cake pan and smooth the top with a spatula. This ensures an even bake.

  • Step 8: Bake the Cake

    Place the cake in the preheated oven and bake for 25-30 minutes. To check for doneness, insert a toothpick in the center; if it comes out clean, the cake is ready.

  • Step 9: Cool the Cake

    Let the cake cool in the pan for 10 minutes before transferring it to a wire rack. This helps prevent it from becoming soggy.

  • Step 10: Dust with Powdered Sugar (Optional)

    Before serving, you can dust the top of the cooled cake with powdered sugar for a decorative touch.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is the best way to measure flour accurately?

To measure flour accurately, use the spoon and level method. Spoon the flour into your measuring cup without packing it down, then level it off with a straight edge, like a knife. This prevents adding too much flour, which can make your cake dense.

How do I know when my cake is done baking?

A cake is done when a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean or with a few moist crumbs. If it comes out wet with batter, it needs more time. Keep an eye on it after the minimum baking time.

Why is it important not to overmix the batter?

Overmixing can develop gluten in the flour, resulting in a dense and tough cake instead of a light and fluffy texture. Mix until just combined for the best results.

How can I prevent my cake from sticking to the pan?

Greasing the pan properly is key. Use butter or cooking spray to coat the pan, then lightly dust it with flour, tapping out the excess. This creates a barrier that helps the cake release easily.

What can I substitute for eggs in this cake?

You can use 1/4 cup of unsweetened applesauce or a flaxseed meal (1 tablespoon ground flaxseed mixed with 3 tablespoons water, let it sit for 5 minutes) as a substitute for each egg. This keeps the cake moist.

How can I tell if my butter is melted without it getting too hot?

Melt the butter in the microwave in short bursts of 10-15 seconds, stirring in between. Alternatively, you can melt it in a small saucepan over low heat. This prevents it from becoming too hot, which could cook your batter.

What should I do if my cake domes in the middle?

If your cake domes in the middle, this could be due to baking at too high a temperature or overmixing the batter. To fix it in the future, ensure your oven is correctly calibrated and avoid overmixing.

Can I add other flavors or ingredients to this cake?

Absolutely! You can personalize your sponge cake by adding spices like cinnamon or nutmeg, or mix in chocolate chips, nuts, or dried fruits for added texture and flavor.

How long can I store the leftover cake and how should I do it?

Store leftover cake in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days. If you want to keep it longer, wrap it tightly in plastic wrap and refrigerate for up to a week or freeze for up to 3 months.

How do I achieve a nice, even layer of powdered sugar on top?

To dust powdered sugar evenly, use a fine mesh sieve or a sifter. Hold it above the cake and gently tap it to sprinkle a light, even layer.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

This Sponge Cake is naturally low in fat due to the use of applesauce, making it a lighter dessert option. For gluten-free guests, substitute all-purpose flour with a gluten-free blend. Those avoiding eggs can try using a flaxseed meal or egg replacer to maintain the cake's structure. To reduce sugar, you can substitute granulated sugar with a sugar alternative, keeping in mind that it might slightly alter the texture.

Pairings

Serve the Sponge Cake with Applesauce alongside a dollop of whipped cream or a scoop of vanilla ice cream for a delightful contrast in texture and temperature. For beverages, consider pairing with a light herbal tea, a glass of sparkling cider, or a chilled sweet dessert wine like Moscato. If you enjoy a bit of zest, a citrus-infused iced tea would also complement the sweetness of the cake beautifully.

Serving Suggestions

Slice the Sponge Cake into wedges and present on a decorative cake stand for an appealing display. Serve with fresh fruit such as strawberries, raspberries, or apple slices to enhance the flavor profile and add a pop of color. For a more festive occasion, consider garnishing with mint leaves or edible flowers, and dusting with powdered sugar for a touch of elegance. The cake can be served at room temperature or slightly warmed for a more indulgent experience.

#

Sponge Cake with Applesauce

40 min
$1.5
180 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 8

Allergens:

EggsWheat

Dietary Tags:

Vegetarian

Cuisine:

American

Course:

Dessert

Tags:

DessertEasyQuick

Description

A light and fluffy sponge cake made moist and delicious with the addition of applesauce!

Ingredients

  • all-purpose flour: 1 cup
  • granulated sugar: 1/2 cup
  • baking powder: 1 tsp
  • salt: 1/4 tsp
  • eggs: 3 large
  • applesauce: 1/2 cup
  • vanilla extract: 1 tsp
  • butter: 2 tbsp, melted
  • powdered sugar: optional, for dusting

Date Created:

11/16/2024
